title: La defensa Luzhin (The Luzhin Defence)

In English

La defensa Luzhin (The Luzhin Defence)

Short image: http://i188.photobucket.com/albums/z163/Burdress/La_defensa_Luzhin-1.jpg


MOVIE DATA

Original title: The Luzhin Defence

Nationality: UK

Year Of Production: 2000

Director: Marleen Gorris

Writers: Vladimir Nabokov (novel) and Peter Berry (screenplay)

Cast: John Turturro (Aleksandr Ivanovich \&#039;Sascha\&#039; Luzhin), Emily Watson (Natalia Katkov), Stuart Wilson (Leo Valentinov), Geraldine James (Vera, Natalia\&#039;s Mother), Christopher Thompson (Jean de Stassard), Fabio Sartor (Dottore Salvatore Turati), Alexander Hunting (Joven Aleksandr Luzhin), Peter Blythe (Ilya), Orla Brady (Aunt Anna), Mark Tandy (Luzhin\&#039;s Father), Kelly Hunter (Luzhin\&#039;s Mother)...

Running time: Approx. 104 mins.

Genre: Drama / Romance.

Synopsis: 1929: Alexander Luzhin, shambling, unworldly and eccentric chess Grand Master arrives in a North Italian lakeside resort to play the match of his career. A childhood prodigy, chess has been his refuge and his passion in a life bereft of love and affection.

His boyhood haunts him still: the breakup of his parents\&#039; loveless marriage; the death of his mother; the rejection by his Aunt Anna, the only adult who ever showed him affection and who introduced him to the game; the moment when his genius is finally recognised - and exploited.

Into the adult Luzhin\&#039;s obsessional life comes Natalia, a beautiful Russian woman, whose aristocratic emigre parents are determined to marry her off well. Her mother, Vera, has her eye on the perfect candidate: Comte Jean de Stassard, a charming and extremely presentable chess amateur who has come to the resort to follow the tournament...
